item.title: Magdalena add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I have nothing to declare except my genius." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Magdalena add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description:
"Alice laughed. 'There's no use trying,' she said. 'One can't believe impossible things.'
I daresay you haven't had much practice,' said the Queen. 'When I was your age, I always did it for half-an-hour a day. Why, sometimes I've believed as many as six impossible things before breakfast. There goes the shawl again!" -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Magdalena add a quote by Jeffrey Eugenides
item.description: "She held herself very straight, like Audrey Hepburn, whom all women idolize and men never think about." -- Jeffrey Eugenides

item.title: Magdalena add a quote by George Sand
item.description: "One is happy once one knows the necessary ingredients of happiness: simple tastes, a certain degree of courage, self denial to a point, love of work, and above all, a clear conscience." -- George Sand

item.title: Magdalena add a quote by Francois Mauriac
item.description: "If you would tell me the heart of a man, tell me not what he reads, but what he rereads." -- Francois Mauriac

item.title: Magdalena add a quote by Annie Lamott
item.description: "No" is a complete sentence." -- Annie Lamott
